gameData.definition: A congress convened by British officials in 1754 promoting a unification of British colonies in North America for security and defense against the French.
Two battles, fought on April 19, 1775, that opened the Revolutionary War.
A 1777 British defeat . Major turning point in Revolutionary War. Defeat convinced French to ally with the US against Britain.
On March 5, 1770,  a mob of angry Bostonians began throwing rocks and sticks at the British troops who were occupying the city.
On December 16, 1773, a band of Bostonians disguised themselves as Native Americans and destroyed chests of tea aboard ships in the harbor.
A meeting convened in 1774 for delegates from twelve of the thirteen colonies (Georgia abstained) in order to protest the Intolerable Acts.
A war waged in North America among the major European powers in mid 1700s. Part of Seven Years war.
Those who chose to support Britain during the Revolutionary War.
An economic theory predominant in the 1700s that held that nations should amass wealth to increase their power.
